Theme collection for highcharts

Source: R/theme-538.R, R/theme-alone.R, R/theme-bloom.R, and 20 more
hc_theme_538.Rd

Highcharts is very flexible so you can modify every element of the chart. There are some exiting themes so you can apply style to charts with few lines of code.

Chalk theme for highcharts was inspired by https://www.amcharts.com/inspiration/hand-drawn/.

Elementary (OS) theme for highcharts was based on https://elementary.io

Firefox theme was inspired by https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/styleguide/.

Flat and flatdark theme is inspired by https://github.com/chriskempson/base16 and https://github.com/cttobin/ggthemr#flat

ggplot2 theme is based on https://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/.

Google theme for highcharts is based on https://books.google.com/ngrams/.

Hand Drawn theme for highcharts. Inspired by https://www.amcharts.com/inspiration/hand-drawn/.

Monokai is a well know text editor theme.

For Null theme the axis are removed (visible = FALSE).

Theme smpl design is inspired by https://github.com/hrbrmstr/hrbrmisc/blob/master/R/themes.r and color by https://www.materialui.co/flatuicolors.

Sparkline theme is based on http://www.highcharts.com/demo/sparkline and this post http://jkunst.com/blog/posts/2020-06-26-valuebox-and-sparklines/.

The superheroes theme is inspired by https://public.tableau.com/profile/ryansmith#!/vizhome/HeroesofNewYork/SuperheroesinNewYork

hc_theme_538(...)

hc_theme_alone(...)

hc_theme_bloom(...)

hc_theme_chalk(...)

hc_theme_darkunica(...)

hc_theme_db(...)

hc_theme_economist(...)

hc_theme_elementary(...)

hc_theme_ffx(...)

hc_theme_flat(...)

hc_theme_flatdark(...)

hc_theme_ft(...)

hc_theme_ggplot2(...)

hc_theme_google(...)

hc_theme_gridlight(...)

hc_theme_handdrawn(...)

hc_theme_monokai(...)

hc_theme_null(...)

hc_theme_sandsignika(...)

hc_theme_smpl(...)

hc_theme_sparkline(...)

hc_theme_sparkline_vb(...)

hc_theme_superheroes(...)

hc_theme_tufte(...)

hc_theme_tufte2(...)

Arguments

...

A named parameters to modify the theme.

Examples


highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_538())


highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_alone())
  

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_bloom())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_chalk())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_darkunica())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_db())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_economist())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_elementary())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_ffx())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_flat())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_flatdark())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_ft())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_ggplot2())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_google())

  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_gridlight())

  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_handdrawn())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_null())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_sandsignika())

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_smpl())
  

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_sparkline())
  
  

highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_sparkline_vb())


highcharts_demo() %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_superheroes())
  

n <- 15

dta <- data.frame(
  x = 1:n + rnorm(n),
  y = 2 * 1:n + rnorm(n)
)

highchart() %>%
  hc_chart(type = "scatter") %>%
  hc_add_series(data = list_parse(dta), showInLegend = FALSE) %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_tufte())


highchart() %>%
  hc_chart(type = "column") %>%
  hc_add_series(data = round(1 + abs(rnorm(12)), 2), showInLegend = FALSE) %>%
  hc_xAxis(categories = month.abb) %>%
  hc_add_theme(hc_theme_tufte2())
